Sentence.sentence: The reason is that when carbon is priced, those emissions reductions that are least costly to implement will happen first.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Most of the training for advanced-math competitions happens outside the confines of the normal school day.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Why, then, has this claim become so popular?Part of the answer is that this is what always happens during periods of high unemployment—in part because experts and analysts believe that declaring the problem deeply rooted, with no easy answers, makes them sound serious.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That is far less likely to happen if Congress also adopts strong pay-go rules requiring that any increase in payments to providers be offset by new taxes or budget cuts.

Sentence.sentence: No one knows how to make that happen quickly.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: If this is not happening today, we should ask why.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What happens to the centralized  electric grid, which took decades and billions of dollars to build, as more and more people become prosumers,  who produce and consume their own energy on-site?No one knows which – if any – battery technology will ultimately dominate, but one thing remains clear: The  future of energy is in how we store it.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Studying at university will only become less attractive if employers shift their focus away from where someone went to university--and there is no sign of that happening anytime soon.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Today, I’d like to talk about what happens when celebrity role models get behind healthyhabits, but at the same time promote junk food.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: For this to happen, he suggests the multi-cultural managers exhibit understanding of their own and others’cultural influences and limitations.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And it may be especially discouraging if you happen to be looking for a job or hoping to change careers right now.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: American educates so manymore people at university that one can’t expect all those who go to be as intelligent as the much narrower band in British universities, says the professor Christopher Rakes at Boston university, I’m not against elitism, but I happen to like having people who are more eager to learn.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "We as a society need to understand that, when we don't punish lying, we increase the probability it will happen again," Ariely says.

Sentence.sentence: A car that takes off from London street and lands in another random street is unlikely to happen," says Prof.

Sentence.sentence: And for this to happen, we may need action on a global scale.

Sentence.sentence: For this to happen, he suggests the multi-cultural managers exhibit understanding of their own and others' cultural influences and limitations.

Sentence.sentence: I don't know what will happen to the next generation.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: I don't think we know exactly what's going to happen but it's certainly possible that we could get very slow growth over the next year or two.

Sentence.sentence: I want to photograph the disaster waiting to happen.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Of course, sometimes things happen at the last moment and I don't have a chance.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Once we recognize that these things happen to us, we are half way to doing something about them.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Professor Stephen Hawking has warned that the creation of powerful artificial intelligence A will be "either the best, or the worst thing, ever to happen to humanity", and praised the creation of an academic institute dedicated to researching the future o
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: That is far less likely to happen if Congress also adopts strong "pay-go" rules requiring that any increase in payments to providers be offset by new taxes or budget cuts.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词语都可表示"发生"之意。
means: happen ： 普通用词，泛指一切客观事物或情况的发生，强调动作的偶然性。
occur ： 较正式用词，可指意外地发生，也可指意料中的发生。
chance ： 侧重事前无安排或无准备而发生的事，特指巧合。
take place ： 多指通过人为安排的发生。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 偶然的,无计划的,随意的,杂乱无章的
stems_affixes.word_buile: hap机会,运气+hazard冒险的事,游戏→运气加游戏→偶然的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 快乐的,幸福的;乐意的;令人满意的
stems_affixes.word_buile: hap机会,运气+y……的→happy有运气的→幸福的
per全部+hap机会,运气+s表复数→全部都是机会,运气[决定]
hap机会,运气+hazard冒险的事,游戏→运气加游戏→偶然的
happy[adj.快乐的,幸福的;乐意的;令人满意的]+ness性质,状态→happiness幸福,幸运
hap机会,运气+en表动词→happen机会来了→发生

expand_knowledge_list.cn:
happen偶然突发事件，多指不幸的事
take place指按计划发生，好坏都有

jx.jx_en_mean: actually; as a matter of fact

lj.lj_ly: we've got a room vacant, as it happens.
lj.lj_ls: 实际上我们有一间房空着。

entry.def: Something that happens occurs or is done without being planned.

example.ex: We cannot say for sure what will happen...
example.tran: 我们无法确定会发生什么事。

example.ex: The accident happened close to Martha's Vineyard.
example.tran: 事故发生在玛莎葡萄园附近。

entry.def: If something happens, it occurs as a result of a situation or course of action.

example.ex: She wondered what would happen if her parents found her...
example.tran: 她不知道如果父母找到自己会有什么结果。

example.ex: He trotted to the truck and switched on the ignition. Nothing happened.
example.tran: 他匆匆走向卡车并转动点火开关，结果没有任何反应。

entry.def: When something, especially something unpleasant, happens to you, it takes place and affects you.
entry.tran: （尤指不愉快的事）发生（在…身上）;(某人)遭到;遇到

example.ex: If we had been spotted at that point, I don't know what would have happened to us...
example.tran: 如果当时我们被发现了，我不知道会有什么后果。

example.ex: It's the best thing that ever happened to me.
example.tran: 这是我所遇到的最好的事情了。

entry.def: If you happen to do something, you do it by chance. If it happens that something is the case, it occurs by chance.

example.ex: We happened to discover we had a friend in common...
example.tran: 我们凑巧发现我们有一个共同的朋友。

example.ex: I looked in the nearest paper, which happened to be the Daily Mail...
example.tran: 我仔细看了一下离自己最近的那份报纸，正巧是份《每日邮报》。

entry.def: You use as it happens in order to introduce a statement, especially one that is rather surprising.
entry.tran: 碰巧，恰恰（尤引出令人意外的事）

example.ex: She called Amy to see if she had any idea of her son's whereabouts. As it happened, Amy had.
example.tran: 她打电话给埃米，看她是否知道自己儿子的行踪。埃米还真就知道。

sentences.sentence: "The meeting took place off without an incidence"

means.word_mean: 2. happen, occur, or be the case in the course of events or by chance;

sentences.sentence: "It happens that today is my birthday"

means.word_mean: 3. chance to be or do something, without intention or causation;

sentences.sentence: "I happen to have just what you need!"

means.word_mean: 5. come upon, as if by accident; meet with;

sentences.sentence: "I happened upon the most wonderful bakery not very far from here"
"She chanced upon an interesting book in the bookstore the other day"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (superseding the verb hap): from the noun hap + -en

sentences.en: What's happened to your car?

sentences.en: It's the best thing that has ever happened to me.

sentences.en: I hope nothing (= nothing unpleasant) has happened to them.

sentences.cn: 此类事故经常发生。
sentences.en: Accidents like this happen all the time.

sentences.cn: 事故发生在玛莎葡萄园附近。
sentences.en: The accident happened close to Martha's Vineyard.

sentences.cn: 我们无法确定会发生什么事。
sentences.en: We cannot say for sure what will happen...

sentences.cn: 如果上述情况发生，情绪激动地消费者会努力劝说其他人共同抵制某公司的产品，从而危及到企业的声誉。
sentences.en: If that happens, passionate consumers would try to persuade others to boycott products, putting the reputation of the target company at risk.

sentences.cn: 因为美国的大学正在发生一些奇怪的事，而这被哈佛大学英语教授路易斯.梅南巧妙地捕捉到了。
sentences.en: For something curious has been happening in American universities, and Louis Men and, a professor of English at Harvard University, captured it skillfully.

sentences.cn: 要么安特吉公司从未想真正地兑现这些承诺，要么是它根本就没有预见到未来会发生什么事情。
sentences.en: Either Entergy never really intended to live by those commitments, or it simply didn’t foresee what would happen next.

sentences.cn: 在当今世界,高薪聘请的高管们不应该对他们运营的机构所发生的事情负责已经成为常态，也许我们也不应该如此惊讶。
sentences.en: In today’s world, it has become normal that well—paid executives should not be accountable for what happens in the organizations that they run. Perhaps we should not be so surprised.

sentences.cn: 下届总统大选中可能会避而不谈的问题是中产阶级面临的令人烦恼不已的难题之一：如果机器人开始抢夺他们的工作，会发生什么?
sentences.en: Among the annoying challenges facing the middle class is one that will probably go unmentioned in the next presidential campaign: What happens when the robots come for their jobs?

sentences.cn: 这并没有发生。
sentences.en: It has not happened.

sentences.cn: 当被单独留在房间里时，那些不知道哪些笔会让他们触电的学生比那些知道会发生这种情况的学生按了更多的笔，并且遭受了更多的电击
sentences.en: When left alone in the room, the students who did not know which ones would shock them clicked more pens and incurred more jolts than the students who knew what would happen.

sentences.cn: 假设你正和某个陌生人共处一室，你心里有个声音说“我想和这个人交谈”——这在我们所有人身上大概都会发生
sentences.en: Suppose you are in a room with someone you don't know and something within you says" I want to talk with this person”—this is something the mostly happens with all of us.

sentences.cn: 相信我，眼神交流是所有奇迹发生的地方。
sentences.en: Trust me, eye contact is where all the magic happens.

sentences.cn: 部分原因在于，这一现象总是发生在失业率很高的时期，还有一部分原因在于，那些专家和分析人士认为，如果宣称问题根深蒂固，很难解决，那么就会让人觉得他们很有深度。
sentences.en: Part of the answer is that this is what always happens during periods of high unemployment—in part because experts and analysts believe that declaring the problem deeply rooted, with no easy answers, makes them sound serious.

sentences.cn: 20 世纪 20 年代，瑞士心理学家 JeanPiaget 提出，儿童的认知能力是 ( 33 )  自然而然地发展起来的，就像一朵花的绽放过程，而且几乎与他们人生中 ( 34 )  发生的其他事无关。

Sentence.sentence: The center's "Shop with Your Doc" program sends doctors to the grocery store to meet with any patients who sign up for the service, plus any other shoppers who happen to be around with questions.

Sentence.sentence: They may not happen as quickly as you'd like them to, and they may turn out to be completely different from the special things you imagined at the beginnings but they will happen.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: To make that happen, you have to help the child find pleasure in learning — to see school as source of joy.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B
